definition: to press into service/to impress/to commandeer
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: The soldiers commandeered the house to use as offices.
sentences.chinese: 士兵强征民房用作办公室。

sentences.english: The ruling says the EU isn't complying with international commerce rules by imposing its anti-dumping duties.
sentences.chinese: 裁定称，欧盟强征反倾销税违法了国际贸易规则。

sentences.english: Most countries clapped on tariffs to protect their farmers.
sentences.chinese: 大多数国家强征关税以保护本国农民利益。

sentences.english: Britain's chancellor imposed a supertax on bankers' bonuses in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 英国财政大臣对英国银行业高管的奖金强征附加税。

sentences.english: All available manpower and draught animals were pressed into service.
sentences.chinese: 所有人力和耕畜都被强征服役。

definition: able-bodied man (capable of fighting in a war)
forced labor/corvée (labor required of a serf)/animal labor
